result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Date remains as previously set.

8:47 AM Defendant Andrew G Peters in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Andrew G Peters.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called to address active warrants. 
Court quashes the warrants in both cases. 
Defense requests signature bond be reinstated in 20CF1377 and a signature bond in 22CF425.
Court reinstates signature bond, but amends to cash bond of $1,500.
In case 22CF425, court sets cash bond of $1,500. 

In case 20CF1377, the State made a motion to revoke the DPA. Court revokes the DPA and sets for sentencing. 
Case 22CF425 is set for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.
